alert.note: Alert for Culberson; Jeff Davis; Reeves (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 13 at 6:46PM CST until February 13 at 7:45PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Culberson County in southwestern Texas... * Until 745 PM CST. * At 645 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 20 miles southeast of McKittrick Canyon to 15 miles north of Valentine, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Observation. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 198. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 13. Locations impacted include... Van Horn, Kent, Fort Davis, Valentine, Bloys Camp, Plateau, Davis Mountains State Park, McDonald Observatory, Black Mountain, Lobo, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp, Culberson County Airport, Indian Lodge and Fort Davis National Historical Site. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
